cyclone.name: CINDY
cyclone.current_location: about 225 miles SE of Galveston, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest, then turning north-northwest toward the upper Texas and southwest Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: upper Texas / southwest Louisiana coast near Sabine Pass-Cameron area

weather_observation.warning_coast: San Luis Pass, TX eastward to the Alabama-Florida border, including Metropolitan New Orleans and Lake Pontchartrain
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central Texas coast eastward through western Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (40–60 mph) with higher gusts likely late Wednesday night into Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Water rises of 1–3 ft, locally up to 4 ft possible along the upper Texas coast including Sabine Pass and the Beaumont/Port Arthur waterway
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated 6 inches, producing flash-flood risk in the Beaumont area
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain bands and very rough seas/strong currents in approaches to the Sabine–Neches Ship Channel
